text:
httpd-2.0.54\docs\conf\ssl-std.conf.in:
SetEnvIf User-Agent ".*MSIE.*" \
         nokeepalive ssl-unclean-shutdown \
         downgrade-1.0 force-response-1.0

This appears to affect non-SSL connections too.
Is this necessary at all?
If so, does this need to apply to non-SSL connections too?

http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=289868
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com

text:
The SetEnvIf is inside the SSL vhost context, so no it doesn't affect non-SSL
configurations.  If the Debian package has it outside the SSL VirtualHost
container that's a Debian bug.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
But the question "Is this necessary at all?" remains.
Do all IE versions require special care or are only some IE versions affected?
creator: OlafvdSpek@GMail.Com

text:
All versions need unclean shutdown at least, not sure about keepalive.  If you
have new data to provide on this front that's great and very welcome, please
send it to dev@.  bugzilla is not a discussion or support forum, however.
creator: jorton@redhat.com
